title: Labour’s view on Aukus important

title: Argentina economy
description: Argentina is divided over the new president's plans for its troubled economy. A court has suspended labour reforms brought in by newly elected Argentine president, Javier Milei. It had been due in a few days to join the group, seen as a counterweight to the Western-led world.

title: Music in Schools: A Plea
description: In the wake of Lord Melvyn Bragg's House of Lords debate on the vital importance of the arts to the UK's society and economy, composer Howard Goodall makes an urgent call for the Government to rethink

title: Public wants answers on the future of the economy
description: Reeves, meanwhile, bemoans a lousy inheritance, and knows that she still has to persuade some voters that Labour can be persuaded with the economy. That’s why she promises to match some of the Tories’ tax and spending plans – to neutralise attacks – and why she is trying so hard to win the confidence of business leaders.

title: New poll makes grim reading for SNP as huge Labour boost predicted
description: LABOUR’S election hopes have been boosted by another poll showing them neck and neck with Nats. The bitter rivals would be locked on 23 seats each in the Westminster vote expected later this year,

title: Police Officers
description: The introduction to the House of Commons of a Bill under the ten minute rule, backed by Labour MP Tonia Antoniazzi, on requiring police officers to declare membership of some organisations, from Wednesday 31 January.

title: Ex-Labour MP who sent explicit texts to teen girl to stand as Reform candidate
description: Simon Danczuk, who was suspended for “inappropriate” behaviour towards the 17-year-old student, is the “right candidate” to tackle Rochdale’s grooming gangs, according to leader Richard Tice

title: Teacher unions' strike is unfortunate, needless; it's like they're having fun — NLC
description: The Executive Secretary of the National Labour Commission NLC, Ofosu Asamoah, has criticised the ongoing strike by various labour unions, describing it as 39;unmeritorious 39; and 39;needless 39;. The unions,

title: Almost a fifth of primary school children have rotting teeth because they eat too many sweets and don't brush their teeth properly
description: A survey of 53,073 children aged ten and 11 found 16 per cent had signs of tooth decay, with affected pupils having two rotten teeth on average, and 3 per cent reporting pain in their mouths.

title: Starmer to press ahead with Labour plans to ‘level-up workers’ rights’
description: Rachel Reeves has refused to give a commitment to lift income tax thresholds. The shadow chancellor said the tax burden is the “highest it has been in 70 years” but it would be “damaging” to promise tax cuts without knowing how they would be paid for.

title: Ex-PM Boris Johnson Attacks Rishi Sunak's New Brexit Deal
description: The PM is required to call an election before the end of 2024, and recent polling indicates the result would be a Labour landslide. A YouGov survey of 14,000 respondents forecasted that the Tories will hold on to just 169 seats, while Labour will claim 385.

title: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk is standing in a by-election for his old seat
description: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk has announced he is seeking to reclaim his old seat in Parliament. The ex-Labour MP will represent Reform UK - the party founded by former UKIP leader Nigel Farage - at the Rochdale by-election later this month.

title: Why Labour’s drawn to a Canadian conservative
description: In time Westminster will come to know these people as the rising stars of Labour’s 2024 intake: Zubir Ahmed, the consultant cardiologist from Glasgow; Lucy Rigby, the City solicitor in Northampton; Kanishka Narayan, the Old Etonian scholarship boy and ...

title: The Times view on Labour’s economic policy: Least Said
description: The party’s lead in the polls owes more to the Conservatives’ taste for self-destruction than an appealing prospectus. It has many questions to answer

title: Rachel Reeves says Labour will govern as ‘pro-business party’
description: No hike in corporation tax, unlimited bonuses for bankers and stability for businesses – Labour have burnished their charm offensive towards business leaders at a one day summit, kicked off by shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves. She told the assembled CEOs and wealthy investors that Labour would campaign and govern as a “pro-business party”.

title: Labour vows to crackdown on landlords who leave Yorkshire tenants to languish in mouldy homes
description: Labour’s deputy leader Angela Rayner insists her party will “hold landlords to account for mould-infested homes” if they win the next General Election.

description: A woman and her youngest daughter, 3, may have life-changing injuries after Wednesday night’s attack

title: Ex-MP Simon Danczuk suspended for sexting to fight byelection for Reform
description: Former Labour member likely to be up against George Galloway in contest for Rochdale seat

title: Absent councillors turn up for meeting but leave before main business
description: Councillors must attend at least one meeting every six months. If they fail to do this, their seat is automatically vacated. By attending the meeting today, Councillors Gajjar and Mistry – the first to sign the register as well as the first to leave – can claim their allowances until the start of August.

title: Child trafficking on the rise in Oti Region - Chief Director of RCC
description: Mr Issaka Braimah Basintale, the Chief Director of the Oti Regional Coordinating Council ORCC, said the region has been identified as a major transit point for child trafficking and child labour.

title: Former Labour MP Simon Danczuk switches to Nigel Farage's Reform for Rochdale byelection
description: Former Labour MP Simon Danczuk, who was blocked from running for Labour in 2017 after an explicit texting scandal, is standing as the candidate for Nigel Farage's Reform Party

title: UK Covid inquiry in Scotland: Three weeks in 90 seconds
description: The UK Covid 19 inquiry has spent three weeks in Edinburgh looking at the decisions made in Scotland during the pandemic.

title: New Edinburgh tram line route options to be presented 'objectively'
description: Officials said the two options on the table were "not equal" - however councillors voted to present them 'objectively' to the public during an initial 12-week consultation this spring.

title: Tenants hit by seven per cent hike in rents in Redditch council houses
description: REDDITCH Borough council has announced it is increasing council house rent by seven per cent following a full council meeting.

description: The Conservative MP tells Sky's Sophy Ridge it is "open season" on public servants - and calls for more action to tackle social media abuse.

title: Update: Met police cave over restrictions, Palestine march will go down Whitehall
description: The Tories and the police are itching to restrict pro-Palestine marches. But they were rebuffed. Back in October, the former home secretary Suella Braverman wrote to senior police chiefs claiming that “waving a Palestinian flag” may be a criminal offence. Protesters continued to fill the protests with flags.

title: 'Labour risks raining on popular enthusiasm if it keeps kowtowing to overpaid bankers'
description: The Labour Party might be on a charm offensive with the fatcats in high finance, but Mirror columnist Paul Routledge asks if it's really necessary to be cosying quite so close to the bankers

title: Scottish Parliament memorial urged for Cambuslang mining trade unionist Mick McGahey
description: Mick McGahey was an ever-important figure in Scottish politics through his involvement in trade unions and a campaign petitioning for a memorial of him in Holyrood is heating up.

title: Britain plans ‘robocop’ force to protect nuclear sites with paint bombs
description: Britain’s nuclear sites could soon be protected by a “robocop” style police force made up of AI-powered drones equipped with paint bombs and smoke guns.

title: South Gloucestershire green waste charges to double and car parking charges on the way
description: Council leaders are set to rubber-stamp plans to double the cost of garden waste collections and introduce car parking charges in South Gloucestershire despite huge opposition from residents.

title: Welsh government's humiliation after millions spent on music festival farm it can't use
description: Since 2003, the primary Green Man Festival has been held near Crickhowell in Powys, consistently drawing crowds of up to 25,000.

title: Bleak economic backdrop and raw politics explain Labour's looming climbdown on green investment pledge
description: With the prospect of an election win within Labour's grasp, Rachel Reeves doesn't seem to want to take the risk of sticking to Labour's green investment pledge. New economic forecasts in the March budget could well be her escape route.

title: Jeremy Hunt plans to cut 1p off National Insurance in major Spring Budget move
description: Jeremy Hunt is considering cutting an extra penny off National Insurance in a Spring Budget giveaway. Speaking to the Daily Express, the Chancellor vowed he would prioritise tax cuts that boost growth.

title: Shattered Nation: Inequality and the Geography of A Failing State – book review
description: Danny Dorling’s new book, Shattered Nation, contains a wealth of data on the impact of inequality on British society over the last fifty years, finds Graham Kirkwood Britain is a failing state.

title: Five things to know about International Women’s Day
description: The annual event celebrating women and defending their rights has its roots in the Russian revolution and remains a red letter day for gender justice.

title: Bradford referenced in major report on how councils are funded
description: Funding model for local councils broken' The committee is made up of both Conservative and Labour MPs, and Clive Betts, Labour chair of the committee said: “Long-term reform is vitally needed. “The funding model for local councils is broken.”

title: Labour MP Margaret Hodge received a death threat today
description: Former Labour Minister and MP for Barking Dame Margaret Hodge has been involved in politics since the 1970s. She says abuse towards MPs has been an issue throughout her career.

title: EUR/USD Forecast: Extra losses remain in the pipeline
description: When it came to the greenback, the USD Index (DXY) remained within the multi-session consolidative range as market participants continued to digest the latest FOMC event on January 31.

title: Jacob Rees-Mogg Taken To School By Farmer Angry At Brexit
description: Jacob Rees-Mogg was given a rude awakening on his GB News show after a farmer disputed his claims Brexit has been good news for British agriculture. To mark the fourth anniversary of the UK officially leaving the European Union, the Tory MP said on X he wouid be “discussing the great benefits of Brexit” on his programme.

description: Labour will not hike the rate of corporation tax during its first term, shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves said as she promised to

title: Penny Mordaunt 'shocked' by Senedd expansion plan
description: Plans to raise the number of Senedd members from 60 to 96 cleared their first hurdle in Cardiff on Tuesday. During business questions in Westminster, Ms Mordaunt said she was "shocked" by the plans to "massively increase" the number of MSs. The Welsh government has been approached for comment.

title: Last minute bid to save community halls as Falkirk Council warns closure possible
description: Last minute expressions of interest included one from Grangemouth Education Unit, where councillors have been meeting since the closure of Falkirk Town Hall. Another came from Bonnybridge Community Centre, where the management committee are still desperately hoping more volunteers will come forward to help.

title: Monmouthshire council ban on dogs in public spaces
description: NEW by-laws requiring dog walkers to pick up their pooch’s poo in all public spaces could come into force this May. Monmouthshire County Council has estimated some 330 new signs setting out what is required of dog owners – and marking areas which the animals are banned from – will cost around £37,000.

title: Labour stresses stability and no surprises as it courts business leaders
description: Promise to end zero-hours contracts gained little mention at conference with 400 executives preparing for expected new government

title: Keir Starmer woos fat cats instead of helping the poor
description: “ Labour is the party of business,” Keir Starmer proclaimed in front of a room of city fat cats this afternoon. Well, they’re certainly not a party serious about tackling poverty.

title: Jeremy Miles makes 'sustainable economic growth' top priority in First Minister manifesto
description: The current Eduction Minister, one of two candidates hoping to succeed Mark Drakeford as Welsh Labour leader, said his particular focus will be on the economy as he put forward his plan "to make Wales a more prosperous and compassionate country."
